CatDescriptText: Diane Powell, student, McKees Rocks and John Pippin (Flippin), unemployed, Hill District, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, August 19, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "what action, if any, should be taken and by whom, when Negro members of integrated teams refuse to play before segregated crowds?"  Ms. Powell's answer reads: "I just don't believe in segregation at all.  How can we have peace with other countries if we can't get long [along] with each other right here?"  Mr. Pippin's (Flippin's) answer reads: "The players should go ahead and play, whether the audience is integrated or not.  That's their job and that's what they're paid to do.  If they want to press for integration, it should be done beforehand."
